title: Uber Settles Bankrupt Ex-Engineer’s Demand That It Pay $179 Million Google Judgment
sub_head: Self-driving-vehicle engineer Anthony Levandowski sued his former employer, Uber, in his personal bankruptcy case, demanding it cover a civil trade-secrets judgment in favor of Google
body:
Uber Technologies Inc. resolved a bankruptcy-court lawsuit over its alleged involvement in a theft of Google’s driverless-car technology, agreeing to settle with a former engineer who had claimed that Uber was culpable for his role in the misappropriation of trade secrets.
Anthony Levandowski, who pleaded guilty in 2020 to stealing autonomous-vehicle technology from Alphabet Inc.’s Google, had sued the alleged recipient of his theft in his personal bankruptcy case, demanding that Uber cover a related $179 million civil judgment...
